oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Brassicas in sustainable production and organic farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Thorup-Kristensen, Kristian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Vegetables
Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Brassica plant species show some characteristics in their use of plant nutrients which make them different from most other crops. These characteristics often make brassicas difficult to grow in low-input systems with limited nutrient availability, but at the same time they also make some brassica species valuable tools for reducing nitrate leaching losses and improving N management in farming systems. The paper presents experimental results on brassica crops as main crops and cover crops.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Thorup-Kristensen, Kristian (2008) Brassicas in sustainable production and organic farming. In: Programme and Abstract book, 5th ISHS International Symposium on Brassicas and the 16th Crucifer Genetics Workshop, p. 30.
